intro: Echium vulgare subsp. coincyanum, commonly known as the blueweed or common viper's bugloss, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and its flowers are arranged in dense spikes. The subspecies coincyanum is distinguished by its more intense blue coloration compared to other subspecies of Echium vulgare.
